technical_concept: The 'docker run' command creates and starts a container from an image. If the image isn't available locally, Docker automatically downloads it from Docker Hub (a public registry of images). 'docker ps' shows running containers. Real-world use: spin up a web server, database, or any tool in seconds â€” no installation required.

code_example.code:
docker run hello-world
docker ps
docker images

challenge.task: Run the classic 'hello-world' container to verify Docker is working end-to-end.
challenge.hint: The run command starts a container. Add flags for background mode.

dialogue.line: Now that we know our tools work, it's time to summon your very first creature! The incantation is 'docker run' followed by the creature's true name.
What creature shall I summon, Master?
Start with the simplest one â€” 'hello-world'. It's a tiny friendly sprite that appears, delivers a message, and vanishes. Perfect for beginners.
What if I don't have the blueprint for this creature?

Ah, that's the beauty! Docker will fly to the Great Library â€” called Docker Hub â€” and fetch the blueprint automatically. Thousands of blueprints live there: web servers, databases, programming languages... all free for the summoning.
So I can summon a whole web server without building it myself?
Indeed! 'docker run nginx' gives you a web server. 'docker run postgres' gives you a database. But first, let's start simple. Summon the hello-world sprite!
So... ready for our first real date? I've got something special planned. Type 'docker run hello-world' and see what happens.
What's hello-world? Sounds a bit basic for a first date.
Trust me. It's a classic. Quick, simple, and it tells you everything is working between us. Think of it as the 'are we compatible?' test.
And if I don't have this hello-world thing?

Don't worry, I'll grab it for you. I know a place â€” Docker Hub. It's like an app store, but for containers. Thousands of ready-made images: nginx for web servers, postgres for databases... I'm very well-connected. ðŸ˜‰
So you're telling me I can get a fully running database in one command?
Now you're getting it. But let's not rush things. First dates first. Run hello-world for me.
